intro: Rubus schnelleri, commonly known as the Schäfer's blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, dark red berries that are edible but often tart in flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important part of the local ecosystem, supporting various wildlife species.
